definition: in or to or toward a past time, (American football) the position of a player on a football team who is stationed behind the line of scrimmage, to strengthen by providing with a back or backing, located at or near the back of an animal
details:
adverb
- in or to or toward a past time
= example: in or to or toward a past time
= synonyms: backward
- at or to or toward the back or rear
= example: at or to or toward the back or rear
= synonyms: backward, backwards, rearward, rearwards
- in repayment or retaliation
= example: in repayment or retaliation
- in or to or toward a former location
= example: in or to or toward a former location
- in or to or toward an original condition
= example: in or to or toward an original condition
- in reply to
= example: in reply to
noun
- (American football) the position of a player on a football team who is stationed behind the line of scrimmage
- a support that you can lean against while sitting
= example: a support that you can lean against while sitting
= synonyms: backrest
- the part of a garment that covers the back of your body
= example: the part of a garment that covers the back of your body
- the protective covering on the front, back, and spine of a book
= synonyms: cover
- the side that goes last or is not normally seen
= example: the side that goes last or is not normally seen
= synonyms: rear
- the posterior part of a body from the neck to the end of the spine
= example: the posterior part of a body from the neck to the end of the spine
= synonyms: dorsum
- the series of vertebrae forming the axis of the skeleton and protecting the spinal cord
= example: the series of vertebrae forming the axis of the skeleton and protecting the spinal cord
= synonyms: spine, backbone, spinal column, rachis
- the part of something that is furthest from the normal viewer
= example: the part of something that is furthest from the normal viewer
= synonyms: rear
- in association football, a person who plays in the backfield, also known as a defender
= example: in association football, a person who plays in the backfield, also known as a defender
verb
- to strengthen by providing with a back or backing
= example: to strengthen by providing with a back or backing
- to establish as valid or genuine
= example: to establish as valid or genuine
= synonyms: back up
- to shift to a counterclockwise direction
= example: to shift to a counterclockwise direction
- to place a bet on
= example: to place a bet on
= synonyms: punt
- to travel backward
= example: to travel backward
- to cause to travel backward
= example: to cause to travel backward
- to support financial backing for
= example: to support financial backing for
- to be behind
= example: to be behind
= synonyms: support
- to give support or one's approval to
= example: to give support or one's approval to
= synonyms: second, endorse, indorse
- to be in back of
= example: to be in back of
adjective
- located at or near the back of an animal
= synonyms: hind, hinder
- related to or located at the back
- of an earlier date
